The marriage of Dr. Judith Wilson Smith and David Ezekiel Fairbank took place yesterday at St. Luke's Episcopal Church in Darien, Conn. The Rev. Alice Farquhar-Mayes performed the ceremony.

The bride, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James W. Smith of Greenwich, Conn., is an orthopedic resident at the Hospital for Special Surgery in New York. She graduated from Miss Porter's School, Princeton University and the Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons. She was presented at the New York Junior League Debutante Ball and at the Debutante Cotillion and Christmas Ball.

Her father is on the staff of New York Hospital and is an associate professor in the division of plastic and reconstructive surgery at the New York Hospital-Cornell University Medical College. Her mother, Nancy Keck Smith, is an owner of the Homestead Inn in Greenwich.

Mr. Fairbank is a son of the late Kellogg Fairbank and the late June W. Taylor of Chicago and is a stepson of Dr. John W. Taylor of Chicago. He is a graduate of the United States Merchant Marine Academy and is eastern regional manager of the Kana Corporation of Chicago, an importer of chemicals. He will begin studies in June at the New York University Graduate School of Business Administration. His stepfather, who is retired, was president of the University of Louisville and deputy director general and acting director general of Unesco in the 1950's.
